main

Class WordOccurrence

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.WordOccurrence

  • public class WordOccurrence
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that process a file and return a map with all the words occurrences Also process a map of words and counters and return a list of the words with more occurrences

      private int sortEntryList(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> a, java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> b)
      Returns integer depending on the input(-1 , 0 , 1) depending on the input; if the value of a entry is more than the value of b entry, it will return -1 if both values are equal it will return 0 otherwise it will return 1
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordOccurrence(java.io.File file)
      Returns Map if the file exist and contains words.

    • Method Detail

      • wordOccurrence

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordOccurrence(java.io.File file)
                                                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Returns Map if the file exist and contains words. More formally, it will return a map with all the words that the file contains and it concurrence, where the key is the word itself, and the value is the number of occurrences in the file.
        Parameters:
        file - file that will be checked by the wordOccurrence.
        Returns:
        Map if the file contains words
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist

      • getTopCounters

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer>> getTopCounters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordsCounter,
                                                                                              int top)
        Returns List> it returns the amount of entries that would be define by the top variable. Sorted in decreasing order.
        Parameters:
        wordsCounter - the map which will be processed
        top - the number which determine the words on the list
        Returns:
        List> if the file contains words

      • sortEntryList

        private int sortEntryList(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> a,
                          java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> b)
        Returns integer depending on the input(-1 , 0 , 1) depending on the input; if the value of a entry is more than the value of b entry, it will return -1 if both values are equal it will return 0 otherwise it will return 1
        Parameters:
        a - first entry to be compared
        b - second entry to be compared
        Returns:
        integer depending on the input(-1 , 0 , 1)
